title: Investment Portfolio Simulation
body: Django project to model and simulate the evolution of investment portfolios with multiple assets. Includes data loading from Excel, REST API to query financial metrics and graphical visualizations. Allows simulating operations and following best practices with structure based on Django Styleguide.

content.detail:
Original test
Technical question
Definitions
An investment portfolio is composed of a combination of N assets. At each time instant t the dollar amount for asset i is given by the variable x{i,t} and therefore the total value of the portfolio at time t Vt is equivalent to:

Vt = ∑Ni=1 xi,t

The price of each asset over time is given by p{i,t} and the quantity of each asset over time is given by c{i,t} such that:

x{i,t} = p{i,t} * c{i,t}

In turn, the weight w{i,t} of each asset is known as the % that this represents on the total portfolio. In other words:

wi,t = (xi,t) / Vt = (pi,t × ci,t) / Vt

Consider a portfolio that starts at t = 0 with initial value V0. The amount invested per asset (c{i,0}) can be calculated using the previous definitions which results in:

C{i,0} = w{i,0} * V0 / P{i,0}

In the following file:
datos.xlsx
There are two data sets separated by sheet:
- Weights: values for w{i,0} of two portfolios (1 and 2 in columns C and D respectively) where time t=0 equals 15/2/22 and i = 1, 2 ...,17 corresponds to each of the 17 investable assets
- Prices: values for P{i,t} where each column corresponds to each of the 17 assets and each row corresponds to time t = 15/2/22,... 16/2/23

Questions

1. Create a Django project that allows modeling the previous definition. That is, assets, portfolios, prices, quantities, weights, amounts and any other element you deem appropriate. Consider that the project must allow answering the following questions
2. Generate an ETL-type function that allows reading and loading data from the datos.xlsx file to the database corresponding to the django project mentioned in the previous point
3. Consider that both portfolio 1 and portfolio 2 have an initial value on 15/02/22 (V0) of $1,000,000,000. Calculate the initial quantities (C{i,0}) for each of the 17 assets in each of the 2 portfolios.
4. From 15/02/22 onwards, the quantity values remain invariant, C{i,t} = c{i,0}, and therefore the values of x{i,t} ; w{i,t} and Vt evolve due to the variation over time of prices p{i,t} and the definitions explained at the beginning of the document. Generate REST API-type endpoints that receive the parameters fecha_inicio and fecha_fin and return the values between those dates for w{i,t} and Vt. Django ORM usage is expected to obtain the data necessary for calculations
5. Bonus 1: Generate a view that uses the previous API where you can graphically compare the evolution over time of the variables w{i,0} and Vt. For w{i,t} a "stacked area" type chart is recommended and for Vt line charts.
6. Bonus 2: Now consider creating a method that allows processing asset buy and sell operations. The above must allow processing that on 15/05/2022 a buy and sell operation is carried out, where $200,000,000 of the USA asset is sold and $200,000,000 of Europe is bought in portfolio 1. Calculate the new history of c{i,t} ; x{i,t} ; w{i,t} and Vt
7. Bonus: Structure the Django project following the following style guide: Django-Styleguide.
